prompt: Create Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 MDT configuration for hardware inventory/state: stream inventory entities and platform slot instance state. Use gRPC no TLS. Collector 192.0.2.196 port 57500. Sample every 10 minutes.
candidate:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group HW-INVENTORY-STATE
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-sdr-inventory-vm-oper:nodes/node/node-entries/node-entry
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-sdr-inventory-vm-oper:nodes/node/node-entries/node-entry/platform-slot-instances/platform-slot-instance/state
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv4
   destination 192.0.2.196
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription SUB-HW-INVENTORY-STATE
  sensor-group-id HW-INVENTORY-STATE sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !
expected:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INV-OPER
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory/entities/entity
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper:platform/racks/rack/slots/slot/instances/instance/state
 !
 subscription SUB-INV
  sensor-group-id INV-OPER sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-INV
 !
 destination-group DG-INV
  address-family ipv4 192.0.2.196 port 57500
   encoding self-describing-gpb
   protocol grpc no-tls
  !
 !
!
rationale: The candidate config correctly uses gRPC no TLS, the correct IP (192.0.2.196), and port (57500), and the encoding self-describing-gpb, meeting the hard requirements. The sample interval is set to 600000 ms (10 minutes), which matches the request. However, the sensor-paths differ from the expected ones: the candidate uses Cisco-IOS-XR-sdr-inventory-vm-oper paths, while the expectation uses Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper and Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper paths. These are related to hardware inventory and platform slot instance state but are not the exact expected paths. The naming of sensor-groups and destination-groups differs but is acceptable. Overall, the config is mostly correct but with some deviation in sensor-paths.
